poem_title: A POEM. Humbly Presented to His most Sacred Majesty
author: Susanna Centlivre (n√©e Freeman)
poem_alt_title: Humbly Presented to His most Sacred Majesty

lines.line_text: LARK, while she her Gratitude to prove,
Lauds with her sprightly Notes, immortal
Shuts not his Ear against the SPARROWS Lays;
Whose tuneless Pipe can only chirp his Praise.
Thus I, tho' Learned Bards before have strung
Their sounding Lyres, and most divinely Sung,
Fear not the Dictates of my Soul to own;
The less of Art, the more of Love is shown:
Vouchsafe, Great Prince, to hear my humble Muse,
And let my Zeal my Want of Skill excuse.

stanzas.stanza_text:
LARK, while she her Gratitude to prove,
Lauds with her sprightly Notes, immortal
Shuts not his Ear against the SPARROWS Lays;
Whose tuneless Pipe can only chirp his Praise.
Thus I, tho' Learned Bards before have strung
Their sounding Lyres, and most divinely Sung,
Fear not the Dictates of my Soul to own;
The less of Art, the more of Love is shown:
Vouchsafe, Great Prince, to hear my humble Muse,
And let my Zeal my Want of Skill excuse.

lines.line_text: HAIL! Hero born to rule, and reconcile
The fatal Discords of our  Isle!
Our pure  long the Mark of
Repriev'd by YOU Escapes her final Doom.
Innumber'd Joys YOU to  bring,
And  thro' the Nation ring.
Delightful  with Fears half dead,
Hears the glad Noise, and rears her pleasing Head;
Her slacken'd Nerves their former Strength regain,
And she her Life redates from GEORGE's Reign.

stanzas.stanza_text:
HAIL! Hero born to rule, and reconcile
The fatal Discords of our  Isle!
Our pure  long the Mark of
Repriev'd by YOU Escapes her final Doom.
Innumber'd Joys YOU to  bring,
And  thro' the Nation ring.
Delightful  with Fears half dead,
Hears the glad Noise, and rears her pleasing Head;
Her slacken'd Nerves their former Strength regain,
And she her Life redates from GEORGE's Reign.

lines.line_text: SO Cruel  tore  ancient State,
And all her Glories seem'd the Sport of Fate;
When by Adoption  took the Reins,
And check'd his People's Heats, and quench'd the Flames;
Enlarg'd her Bounds to distant  Shoar,
And taught her Drooping Eagles how to soar.
YOU Sir, like him, the  Throne ascend;
May equal Victories your Reign attend.
When round the Continent the Trump of Fame
Did  Glory in your Right proclaim,
Tyrannick Monarchs, as with Thunder scar'd,
Sent up their Prayers impending Fates to ward;
Whilst BELGIA's LION brav'd his threaten'd Chain,
Rowl'd his Glad Eyes, and stretch'd his Paws again.

stanzas.stanza_text:
YOU Sir, like him, the  Throne ascend;
May equal Victories your Reign attend.
When round the Continent the Trump of Fame
Did  Glory in your Right proclaim,
Tyrannick Monarchs, as with Thunder scar'd,
Sent up their Prayers impending Fates to ward;
Whilst BELGIA's LION brav'd his threaten'd Chain,
Rowl'd his Glad Eyes, and stretch'd his Paws again.

lines.line_text: BY your fam'd Justice, and your prudent Sway,
shall be taught to Love, or to Obey;
Whilst YOU the Right of Liberty assert,
And all the Ills of broken Faith avert;
To  may Your Succours fly,
Before her Champions 'midst her Ruins dye.
PROPHETICK Sages had this Day in View,
And nam'd our PATRON as a Type of You:
So Men to Oracles had once Regard,
'Till the Great Saviour of the World appear'd.

stanzas.stanza_text:
PROPHETICK Sages had this Day in View,
And nam'd our PATRON as a Type of You:
So Men to Oracles had once Regard,
'Till the Great Saviour of the World appear'd.

lines.line_text: THE swelling Waves, which often heretofore
Our yet lov'd King, the Glorious  bore,
Proud in conveying his Adopted Son,
Part with Regret, and murmur as they run.

stanzas.stanza_text:
THE swelling Waves, which often heretofore
Our yet lov'd King, the Glorious  bore,
Proud in conveying his Adopted Son,
Part with Regret, and murmur as they run.

lines.line_text: WELLCOME great Guardian of our  Land;
Receive the Nation rescu'd by thy Hand.
for private Ends,
Had rais'd her baffled Foes, and sunk her Friends,
Dispers'd her Strength, and Royal  betray'd
Whilst in the Sunshine of her Smiles they play'd;
The Ruin rowl'd too fast for her to stem,
Whose greatest Weakness was her Choice of
When Heav'n, in Pity to those suppliant Few,
Who own'd its Power, and kept their Vows to YOU,
Came to our Aid, revers'd our low'ring Fate,
And by thy destin'd ARM retriev'd the State.

stanzas.stanza_text:
WELLCOME great Guardian of our  Land;
Receive the Nation rescu'd by thy Hand.
for private Ends,
Had rais'd her baffled Foes, and sunk her Friends,
Dispers'd her Strength, and Royal  betray'd
Whilst in the Sunshine of her Smiles they play'd;
The Ruin rowl'd too fast for her to stem,
Whose greatest Weakness was her Choice of
When Heav'n, in Pity to those suppliant Few,
Who own'd its Power, and kept their Vows to YOU,
Came to our Aid, revers'd our low'ring Fate,
And by thy destin'd ARM retriev'd the State.

lines.line_text: HAIL great Deliverer, much lov'd MONARCH Hail!
No more shall  no more shall  prevail:
By Heav'ns Decree, YOU and your Issue stand
Sure Signs of future Safety to this Land.
So when th' Almighty caus'd the Flouds to cease,
He fix'd his Bow in Token of the Peace.

stanzas.stanza_text:
HAIL great Deliverer, much lov'd MONARCH Hail!
No more shall  no more shall  prevail:
By Heav'ns Decree, YOU and your Issue stand
Sure Signs of future Safety to this Land.
So when th' Almighty caus'd the Flouds to cease,
He fix'd his Bow in Token of the Peace.
